intro: Osbeckia darjeelingensis, commonly known as the Darjeeling osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows in moist, temperate environments. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and capsule fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
